DataElement.preferredName: Index And Measurable New Lesion Sum Multiplicative Product Percentage Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The percent change in the sum of the products of the two largest perpendicular diameters (SPD) of all index lesions (five lesions per organ, up to 10 visceral lesions and five cutaneous index lesions) is calculated.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Index And Measurable New Lesion Sum Multiplicative Product
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The largest tumor lesion targeted by therapy._Capable of being measured._The identification of a lesion which has not been previously seen or characterized._The final aggregate amount._A quantity obtained by multiplication.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Index Lesion Measurable New Lesion Identification
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The largest tumor lesion targeted by therapy.:Capable of being measured.:The identification of a lesion which has not been previously seen or characterized.

Concepts.definition: The most clinically significant tumor lesion targeted by therapy. The lesion is typically the largest or highest graded of the tumor foci detected.
The identification of a lesion which has not been previously seen or characterized.

Property.preferredDefinition: The final aggregate amount.:A quantity obtained by multiplication.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: any measurements, including linear dimensions, volume, and weight, of a patient's tumor.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed that is a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Percentage; a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
